definition: to reflect (light)/to shine/to project (an image onto a screen etc)

sentences.english: We saw a preview of the new movie.
sentences.chinese: 我們看了一部新電影的試映。

sentences.english: He says this is the first time he hasn't had to submit a film to the test-screening process (although there have been screenings for marketing purposes).
sentences.chinese: 他說這是他第一次無須將影片交去試映。

sentences.english: PREVIEW】Before the movie was shown to the students, there was a preview for the teachers.
sentences.chinese: 在電影放映給學生看前，對老師先有一場試映。

sentences.english: Dear all attendees of the preview of The Guy was Gorgeous.
sentences.chinese: 親愛的帥小子試映會的與會者們。

sentences.english: The preview at Penghao Theatre will be the first public screening!
sentences.chinese: 本次在蓬蒿劇場試映是首次公開放映。
